message.entry: Select an element in the tree to set its preferences.
These options affect the behavior of all Simulink models
These values will be inherited by new models
These values will be applied to block diagram ''{0}''
Use getInstance to create a Simulink.Preferences instance
Notify when loading an old model
Print a message in the command window when loading a model last saved in an old version of Simulink
Do not load models created with a newer version of Simulink
Displays an error, if trying to load a model created in a newer version of Simulink
Do not load models that are shadowed on the MATLAB path
Displays an error, if trying to load a model that is shadowed by another file of the same name higher up on the MATLAB path
Save a thumbnail image inside SLX files
When saving, include a small screenshot of the model to display in the Current Folder browser preview pane
Show callbacks in the MATLAB Command Window as they are invoked
Open the sample time legend when the sample time display is changed
Controls whether the Sample Time Legend automatically opens when a Sample Time Display choice is selected from the Display menu.
Notify if model has changed on disk when:
Before updating or simulating the model, check the model file timestamp to determine whether the file has changed on disk since it was loaded
Action to take if the file has changed on disk since it was loaded
When first making a change to the model, check whether the file has changed on disk since it was loaded
When saving the model, check whether the file has changed on disk since it was loaded
Save before updating or simulating the model
If the model has unsaved changes, automatically save a backup before updating or simulating, so that the changes can be restored after a crash
Select the fonts to be used by blocks, lines and annotations in ''{0}'' which\nhave their font properties set to "auto"
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. 1234567890
Cause diagrams to appear in the current editor as they did in the original Simulink editor
Show smart editing cues like quick insert, tear-offs and marquee actions
Edit key parameter when adding new blocks
Ability to specify block parameter values right after adding new blocks
Use the scroll wheel on the mouse to control zooming instead of scrolling
Display the New/Save toolbar or the New/Open/Save or no file toolbar
Show the model editor's Print toolbar
Show the model editor's Cut/Copy/Paste toolbar
Show the model editor's Undo/Redo toolbar
Show the model editor's Browse/Backward/Forward/Up toolbar
Show the model editor's Library/Model Configuration/Model Explorer toolbar
Show the model editor's Refresh Blocks toolbar
Show the model editor's Update Diagram toolbar
Show the model editor's Input toolbar
Show the model editor's Simulation toolbar
Show Fast Restart button on the Simulation toolbar
Show the model editor's Debug Model toolbar
Show the model editor's Model Advisor toolbar
Show the model editor's Build toolbar
Show the model editor's Find toolbar
The following settings are used in exporting variables to MATLAB scripts \nvia the Model Explorer and by Simulink.saveVars
Set the maximum elements in an array that saveVars can save to MATLAB file
Set the maximum number of levels of an object, or nested cell/struct hierarchy that saveVars can save to MATLAB file
Limits for writing variables to MATLAB code
Enable using 2-D slices to represent N-D (N > 2) char/logic/numeric array
Set two dimensions for 2-D slices that are used to represent N-D (N > 2) char/logic/numeric array
Set the text wrap width for MATLAB file
Specifies whether to render subsystem blocks translucent to their contents
File format for new models and libraries:
Specifies format to use when saving a new model or library without specifying a file extension
Specifies decoration style for line crossings
Save backup when overwriting a file created in an older version of Simulink
Allows recovery of the original file in case of accidental overwriting with a newer version of Simulink

The following setting is used to create parameter and signal objects\nin the Model Explorer. It is also available in the Data Object Wizard,\nand for specifying embedded signal objects for signals and block states
The following setting is used for specifying embedded signal objects\nfor signals and block states
Clipboard background color mode. Transparency only works for Metafile

For compatibility with previous releases, root block diagram parameters in your Simulink Preferences from {0} have been converted into this model template. For more information, run "doc Simulink.defaultModelTemplate".

% For compatibility with MATLAB code written in previous releases 
% this file sets parameters of Simulink's root block diagram to the values 
% specified in your Simulink Preferences from {0}. 
% For more information, run "doc Simulink.defaultModelTemplate"
Found Simulink Preferences from {0}. These will be converted into a model template for use in this release.\n
